import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.7f476c77:
# README - Data Visualization
## **Author**: Ediberto Ponce
## Overview
- Select 2 Kaggle data sets.{:target=”_blank”} that are suitable for the story you want to tell.
  * Note make sure the data set has csv file/s to download.
- Optionally use dataset from another source.
- Load the data you receive into a Pandas DataFrame.
- Analyze dataset.
- Verbalize your insights in Markdown cells.
- Visualize your insights in several ways.
  * Have at least two visualizations per data set.
  * Use Seaborn Example Gallery for inspiration.
- Notebook should have professional polish.
  * In other words, imagine you are presenting it on the job.
**User Acceptance Tests**
- No automated tests
## Architecture
- Python 3
- numpy
- matplotlib.plyplot
- seaborn

## Credit and Collaborations
- Brandon, Alex, and Connor
## Resources
- [Flights Data](https://www.kaggle.com/koracosmos/flights-data)
- [US Health Insurance Dataset](https://www.kaggle.com/teertha/ushealthinsurancedataset)
- [seaborn example gallery](https://seaborn.pydata.org/examples/index.html)
## Name of feature: Data Visualization
- Estimate of time needed to complete: 5 hours
​
- Start time: 8:00pm (1/25/2022)
​
- Finish time: 8:50pm (1/26/2022
​
- Actual time needed to complete: approx. 3 1/2 hours

## Hypothesis
As we get older in age, we will likely have to visit medical centers more often thus increasing your medical costs due to more frequent visits or more costly treatments.
source.97e2c093:
# Conclusion 2/2
2017 and 2018 data shows massive spikes in flight delays across all airlines and what appears to be a resolving action in 2019. This peaked my interest so after research, it appears that the main contributing factors were: Lack of Staff, Rising Costs, and Overtourism. Simply put, supply and demand.
source.74866a2f:
## Hypothesis
If parents were to choose the most optimal time to have kids, then they'd likeley choose ages 30-40, because of many factors listed in the above conclusion.
source.91346cd0:
# Conclusion 1/2

Based on the data below, health care charges increase the older you get. As most of us get older, we are prone to more health issue due to the basic effects of aging. There are some unexplainable drops in charges in certain age groups however from a linear regression standpoint, there is a consistent upward increase in charges as we get older.
source.8c7f54bc:
# Conclusion 1/2:

If you're like, you probably prefer not to have flight delays when on vacation, business trips, etc. If your time is more important than comftorability, then you're probably going to have a better experience if you avoid flying with Frontier Airlines, Express Jet, Mesa Airlines, and AirTran Airways based off of our data above.
source.974f9832:
## Hypothesis
If airlines experience can't keep up with supply and demand, then it is likely that flights are more prone to delays, because many contributing factors such as lack of staff, rising cost/inflation, and overtourism.
source.d5a73f54:
- UA = United Airlines
- AA = American Airlines
- B6 = JetBlue AIrways Corporation
- DL = Delta Air Lines
- EV = ExpressJet
- MQ = Envoy Air
- US = US Airways
- WN = Southwest Airlines
- VX = Virgin America
- FL = AirTran Airways
- AS = Alaska Airlines
- 9E = Endeavor Air
- F9 = Frontier Airlines
- HA = Hawaiian Airlines
- YV = Mesa Airlines
- OO = SkyWest Airlines
source.b759b634:
# Conclusion 2/2
Per the data below, couples tend to have the most amount of kids while in their 30's. In today's society, the age 30-40 age group tends to be the most common age to have kids due to many factors for ex: job security, maturity, marriage, medical reasoings, etc. They also may of had kids already in their 20's and decided to have a few more in their 30's. The average amount of children seem to decrease as people get older likely due to unfortunate circumstances.
